title: Renaissance Vocabulary
description: Explore the language of art, science, and culture from the European Renaissance (14th-17th century)

questions.question: During the Renaissance, what did 'humanism' primarily refer to?
options: An intellectual movement emphasizing classical learning and human potential

questions.question: What was a 'polymath' in the Renaissance?
options: A person with expertise in many different subjects

questions.question: In Renaissance art, what does 'chiaroscuro' mean?
options: The use of strong contrasts between light and dark

questions.question: What was a Renaissance 'patron'?
options: A wealthy supporter of artists and scholars

questions.question: In the Renaissance, what did 'fresco' mean?
options: Painting done on fresh wet plaster on a wall

questions.question: What was a 'condottiero' in Renaissance Italy?
options: A leader of a mercenary company

questions.question: In Renaissance vocabulary, what was 'perspective' as an artistic term?
options: A technique for creating the illusion of depth on a flat surface

questions.question: What was an 'apothecary' during the Renaissance?
options: A person who prepared and sold medicines

questions.question: In Renaissance culture, what was a 'sonnet'?
options: A 14-line poem with a specific rhyme scheme

questions.question: What did 'bottega' refer to in Renaissance Italy?
options: An artist's workshop where apprentices learned their craft

questions.question: In Renaissance terms, what was a 'triptych'?
What was 'sfumato' in Renaissance painting?
options: A technique of soft, gradual blending of tones without harsh outlines

questions.question: In Renaissance philosophy, what did 'virtue' primarily mean?
options: Excellence, skill, and effective force of character

questions.question: What was a 'loggia' in Renaissance architecture?
options: A gallery or arcade open on one or more sides

questions.question: In the Renaissance, what did 'sprezzatura' mean?
options: A studied nonchalance or effortless grace
